channel.title: Music button help
channel.description: [img]http://img704.imageshack.us/img704/754/screenshot039c.png[/img] I need to make it so the music and effect volume buttons pop up instead of the message saying "Music + Sounds are only available in the high detail version of the game." I know this isn't client-sided because I can log into another server with the same client and those buttons will be there. I think it has something to do with a missing setSidebarInterface or possibly a setClientConfig code that needs to go in the initialize method, but I can't seem to figure out what the codes are. I've been looking in another source I have that has those buttons, but I just can't seem to figure it out. Help? Thanks.

item.title: Music button help
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

Never fucking mind. I fixed it myself, once again. God dammit!

setSidebarInterface(11, 4445); // wrench tab
setSidebarInterface(11, 904); // wrench tab

Read full topic

item.title: Music button help
item.dc:creator: @ownerjosh ownerjosh
item.description:
@ownerjosh wrote:

i suggest remaking a new interface for the tools. That way you wont need to worry about that and it will look new and nice.

Read full topic

item.title: Music button help
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

[quote=“licorish55, post:5, topic:322439”]Urgh. They are currently functional, Obviously, as they display the you must be blah blah blah message.

If you remove that message, your simply one step closer.[/quote]

The text is not found anywhere in any of the java files. It displays that text because the buttons aren’t being called in the client class so instead of leaving it blank, it shows that text. It’s like on the quest tab. When there isn’t a sendQuest being called, the text on the quest tab will just be all of the quests, but if you search for those quests in the files, you’ll never find it, but when you add a sendQuest to appear on the quest tab like this: sendQuest("", 7339); then that line on the quest tab will just show up blank with no text. So it’s not searching for the text in files to get rid of the text, it’s coding in the buttons with a setSidebarInterface or something as I’ve said numerous times above.

Read full topic

item.title: Music button help
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Urgh. They are currently functional, Obviously, as they display the you must be blah blah blah message.

If you remove that message, your simply one step closer.

item.title: Music button help
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

Ike TeeHee:

ya i get the same thing with one of the many sources i have used… it usualy means your going to need to use a diffrent source or client

No, that’s stupid. Why would I get a new source for something as simple as this? That’s dumb. And the client has nothing to do with it.

[quote=“licorish55, post:3, topic:322439”]ClickingMost.Java

I haven’t worked with a 317 lately, but I do know a lot of Action Buttons (thats what they are on 508’s+) are located in the ClickingMost.Java[/quote]

I’m not looking for the buttons to be functional, I’m looking for the buttons to be displayed, which would need some setSidebarInterface or setClientConfig code.

Read full topic
